function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"The social costs of the imposed measures, such as job losses, income inequality, and reduced access to goods, may have significant negative impacts on society.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global supply chain disruptions due to unpredictable shocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of industries to disruptions in global supply chains","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"International interdependencies and vulnerabilities in value chains","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of diversified supply chains leading to dependency on specific regions or countries","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of exports or imports in some industries","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Specific assets and knowledge capital involved in supplier base","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Small open economies relying more on foreign inputs and markets","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High exposure to global trade and gvc-integration leading to vulnerability to contagious diseases propagation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trade-off between efficiency and exposure to shocks in gvcs for certain countries","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative impact on real gdp stability","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious spread of economic instability","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in economic activity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Localised supply chains are found to be more vulnerable to shocks for most countries","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Domestic shocks account for about half of the variation in real gdp due to shocks, illustrating that domestic shocks may be at least as important as a source of instability as foreign shocks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"For 16 out of 22 countries or regions included in the model, real gdp stability falls when all shocks are considered","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation within interconnected supply chains","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Greater localisation of value chains would add further gdp losses to the economic slowdown caused by the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in global real gdp by more than 5% relative to the interconnected regime","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Import and export demand falling in real terms proportionally more than real gdp and domestic production","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased reliance on domestic production","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gdp losses from economic slowdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Centralization of manufacturing and industry in certain countries","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-income economies as key hubs for service sector","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to foreign supply shocks for smaller economies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Systemic implications of central countries and industries in the global production network","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased centrality of china in global production networks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of market share in a few countries for computer-related products and phones","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extreme concentration of trade in a few importing/exporting firms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on foreign value-added and export demand in global value chains","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low diversity of suppliers or buyers in supply chains increasing the probability of disruption and propagation of shocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concentration of suppliers and buyers leading to fragility in the supply chain and market","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of suppliers or clients at a very granular product level","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Amplification of volatility due to concentration in gvcs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Anticompetitive behaviors associated with concentration in gvcs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unnecessary heterogeneity of norms and standards may hinder effective responses to disease outbreaks and decrease resilience in the built environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Competition and diversification in gvcs may lead to increased movement of people and goods, potentially accelerating the spread of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Supply chain disruptions during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of localised economies to economic shocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Warning against reshoring of gvcs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High reliance on foreign demand and value-added in production leading to exposure to foreign shocks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High centrality of \\'hubs\\' in gvc networks magnifying shock propagation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Concentration of suppliers or clients making some firms and supply chains vulnerable to shocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Propagation of economic shocks across different industries and geographical locations through gvcs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on localized production for security of supply","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on global value chains gvcs for essential supplies and production processes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased vulnerability to global shocks due to international specialisation in gvcs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of shocks through global value chains gvcs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruptions in gvcs due to re-localisation policy","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risks and instability associated with international fragmentation of production","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
